item.title: Barriers left, 15th December
item.description:
56-58 Liddington Road These barriers have been up for a very long time. The wall has been removed weeks ago and these barriers not only stop pedestrians from walking on the pavement but are unsightly and obscure access to and from the property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Liddington Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St Anne’s terrace is a one way street yet I see at least 4 cars a day going the wrong way down it., 15th December
item.description:
The problem I believe is the signage for the one way street is too high and should face oncoming traffic… it does not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Saint Annes Terrace, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken rotten fencing, 15th December
item.description:
On Porchester road adjacent to the junction with Millbridge Road as illustrated in the photos. Sadly, once again the rot is down to poor maintenance and neglect. The maxim, 'a stitch in time saves nine' sadly does not feature in maintenance schedules these days with the consequence of repair costs being far higher. I do not approve of my local council tax being wasted in this manner and urge you to ensure that the fencing is repainted more frequently to protect the timbers and extend their life

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Porchester Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: These potholes have been repaired on numerous occasions but go back to holes in no time at all! They continue to be an issueto drivers and in order to avoid them, you have to pull part on to the opposite side of the road., 15th December
item.description:
These potholes are near the junction of New Road, Southam, and Two Hedges Road. They are on the left hand side as you come from southam to Bishops Cleeve. These potholes should be well known to highways as this strip is forever been filled in!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 15th December
item.description:
There are 3 drains along this small stretch of road that are all blocked causing water to run down the road. I have taken a picture of the drain by the steps as it is the only one with a footpath next to it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 15th December
item.description:
Customer reports that a number of white, Doocey, barriers have been left on their (private) verge - there is no work underway. They are causing damage as they are resting against a dry stone wall and could cause it to collapse; they are are unsightly in proximity to their Listed property. They consider this to be an urgent issue and ask that, with Christmas imminent, it is dealt with as quickly as possible. They would appreciate an update asap.
Report on FixMyStreet
